text: Bidaxsh (bidakhsh, also spelled Pitiakhsh; in Roman sources Vitaxa), was a title of Iranian origin attested in various languages from the 1st to the 8th- century. The title was prominent in Armenia and Georgia, being used by the military governor of a province, and being the hereditary title of the dynasts of Gugark. == References == == Sources == * * Category:Positions of authority Category:Sasanian military offices Category:Georgian military ranks of Persian origin Category:Iranian words and phrases
title: Bidaxsh
